topic.title: What happened to the search function?
topic.body: I remember ZeroNets dashboard had a search function a couple months back but it doesnt seem to exist anymore. Does anyone know what happened to that? It was kind of useful for searching through content!

1_1H8x2Aeu28Lnj6vhXFNZ32kpvGS6dnqWGA.body:
Love the concept but I really hope things improve moving forward in regards to truly decentralized identities. Thats one critical issue I really hope to see resolved soon, its an important part of the growth of ZN imo.

unless something has changed since Ive last been on here, but i dont think so.

> [gremious](#comment_13_1H8x2Aeu28Lnj6vhXFNZ32kpvGS6dnqWGA): You can use multiple identities, all you have to do is enable the multiuser plugin and backup the master_seed of your current ID in the users.json file. Then you can login using it or create a new id, back it up too (I have a text file with just my usernames and the seeds for easy copy). To login you just have to go back to zero-hello and click logout>login, pasting the master_seed of whatever account you need. (and quickly pop to ZeroID so that it gives you your username)
> 
> Eh, I like it,  but to each their own. I much prefer it to something old and "techy" and "dark". It's modern and slick. That's about it. 
> 
> That's really about it, isn't it? We just have to see where it goes, I suppose.

I think it should be made easier though... So you can just select which IDs you want to use rather than having to enter a seed. But a bigger priority imo (as mentioned in previous post) is truly decentralized idents.

> [5thvortex](#comment_3_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): you see the 0 trigger  hold it and drag it to the left  i think youll find this pretty usefull  :P

Ohhh, there is that but sadly it doesnt allow me to register another ZeroID when I set it to "Unique to this site" :( . To be fair, thats probably more to do with ZeroID rather than ZeroNet itself.

> [5thvortex](#comment_5_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): you must backup you ID (unique one ) put it elsewhere then create your ID ( you should ) it solve many issue

This is what Id like ZeroNet to improve on. Id like it so you can select multiple identities on the fly without having to move files about, would be much more convenient! That would work at least, so better than nothing!

> [5thvortex](#comment_7_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): you dont if u use different provider

True! Will do that in future, I guess. Now all we need is a truly decentralized ID provider ;)

> [5thvortex](#comment_10_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JeHa67QEvrrFpsSow82fLypw8LoRcmCXk/http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KzwuSAjFnivNimSHuRdPrYd1pNPhuHqN/

Perfect, just what I was looking for, thanks for flagging them up. Wish these would take off more, its much more in keeping with the ZeroNet philosophy. Getting there bit by bit, OneName looks promising too.

Although hopefully we will soon see providers on ZeroNet that will have personalized IDs (names) which work on all ZeroNet sites such as ZeroTalk.

> [5thvortex](#comment_12_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): your welcome keep an eye on my list here has a flag found and upload 0sitehttp://127.0.0.1:43110/1LQNHchUKBBtv5cguPuy92Cy7gLnZJCySs/

Definitely will, interesting times ahead for the ZeroNet!
